comments: The regret of not having taken this course when given the opportunity will be a constant nagging and forever growing weight, an albatross around your neck. Don't second guess your instincts, trust your gut and take the course. Even for those not interested in ed policy, this course will still be a pleasure and one that guarantees to bring tangible learning outcomes.
Honestly one of the best professors I've had in undergrad or grad school.

This course is a great way to see econometrics in action. Although not terribly rigorous, the readings are well chosen and you will actually learn a lot about the empirical support or lack thereof behind different educational policy measures. Additionally the debate and its corresponding memo are a nice way to dig deep into a particular area of education policy. While the requirements throughout the semester are fairly light, it is recommended, though not entirely necessary, that one has a background in econometrics. Additionally, it should be noted that Professor Goodman very strictly follows the HKS curve guidelines. Overall this was a great course and I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants to explore education policy further through the lens on econometrics.
